summary: Adds a Temple with a Shrine to Julianos to Winterhold.
descriptionHtml:
[center][size=6]Temple of Julianos - Winterhold[/size][/center]
[center]I found it odd that there was no dedicated shrine in Winterhold. Yes it was destroyed but given the recent conflicts about divines and how religious the Nords seem to be I just found it odd. Plus Winterhold is one of my favorite Cities/Towns/Ruined place because I normally play as a Mage.

So why Julianos and why Winterhold? I wanted to add something different to Winterhold, something that was not really done before. I did not want to make a massive mod so I thought small. Compact. This was the result. I released a previous mod on STEAM a few years back that just added a shrine to the corner of Winterhold but this time I wanted something in-doors.

I hope you enjoy it.


-MA-

[size=4][u][b]What it does:[/b][/u][/size]

This mod adds a small temple to Julianos in Winterhold. Inside the temple is a Shrine to Julianos.
It is located to the right of the college bridge entrance, just behind one of the ruined houses.

The Temple is not very big (Half a house!) with the other half dedicated to living space for the priest that runs the temple.
The priest has a schedual, he will sandbox in the house from 8am - 8pm where he will then break for food while still inside the temple.
The temple closes its doors at 10pm and reopens at 8am. The door will be locked and you will not be able to access the temple during this time.

The Temple is full Nav-meshed.

Cleaned with TES-EDIT

[size=4][u][b]Compatibility:[/b][/u][/size][/center]
[center]This mod is NOT compatible with any mod that drastically changes Winterhold. So any massive restoration/more ruins mods will conflict.
It is NOT compatible with the STEAM mod: An alchemist for Winterhold as they both use the same location.

It is compatible with:

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50491/?tab=1&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fmoddescription%2F%3Fid%3D50491%26preview%3D&pUp=1]QAXES Winterhold[/url] (I was using this in my play test)
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/65824/?]Winterhold stores[/url] (Alternative to QAXES mod)
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/53975/?]Vellamo - Mage home in Winterhold
[/url]

It is also compatible with my other Winterhold mods:

[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/50148/?]Winterhold Gate[/url]
[url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/77889?]Winterhold Bridge Repair
[/url]
[/center][center][size=4][u][b]Credits:[/b][/u][/size]

Galdran for there [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/70619/?tab=1&navtag=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.nexusmods.com%2Fskyrim%2Fajax%2Fmoddescription%2F%3Fid%3D70619%26preview%3D&pUp=1]DIY Custom Banner[/url]s mod which was used to make the Julianos Banner.
AndrealphusVIII for pointing me towards Galdran's mod.
Nifskope team for Nifskope
DarkFox127: His tutorials are great! Check them out on [url=https://www.youtube.com/user/DARKF0X127]his YouTube channel[/url]

[/center]
author: midgetalien

files.changelogHtml: Removed the "Mara" Banners, adding in custom made banners instead.
